Wednesday, August 19, is the first day of school. As we prepare to begin the new school year through eLearning, we know you have questions.

To provide answers, we invite you to join the Parent Community Involvement Task Force and District staff and administrators for our Parent University: Getting Ready for School and eLearning live webinar sessions. The four events, which take place between August 12-17, are divided by student groups. They will include step-by-step guidance to help parents assist their students through the school day and information on what to expect once classes begin. District personnel will be available after each presentation to answer questions.

Friday, February 14, is designated as A Day of Service and Love in commemoration of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School tragedy.

It will be a day to give back to the community in honor of the 17 students and staff who were lost and those who were injured.

Friday, February 14, is also an early release day and attendance is required. Schools will dismiss at their regular early release times.

As part of A Day of Service and Love, students and staff will take part in service projects and activities that serve others within their schools and communities. The activities are supported by hundreds of volunteers and partnerships with a variety of organizations, including HandsOn Broward, the city of Parkland, the city of Coral Springs and the Interfaith Council.

For families who may need guidance in answering their children’s questions, or may need additional support, please find practical advice on how to talk with children about shootings and terrorist events in the news at bit.ly/2wtofM2. If your child/children are experiencing coping difficulty in response to the recent tragedies, visit Eagles’ Haven, a community wellness center created solely and mindfully for the community. Services are free for current, future, former students, eagleshaven.org. District employees who may be experiencing coping difficulty as a result of the recent mass shootings, please feel free to contact the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) employee.browardhealth.org/pages/eap. EAP services are confidential. You may reach EAP at 754-322-9900.
